description: Dive into "Enchanting Castles of Verona's Heart" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Enchanting Castles of Verona's Heart

places.generalDescription: The Castelvecchio Museum in Verona is a restored palace that houses a diverse collection of sculptures, statues, paintings, ancient weapons, and more. Originally built as a residence and fortress in the 14th century, it now offers visitors an immersive experience into medieval life in Verona. The museum features 16 rooms filled with sacred art, Renaissance bronze statues, archaeological finds, coins, weapons, and armor.

sources.snippet: The Castelvecchio museum display begins at the ground floor with incredible exhibitions of Romanesque and Gothic sculpture. Work of art that still today amaze visitors with their expressive power. The art collections are displayed around the rooms and pathways inside and outside Castelvecchio courtyard, battlements, and walls.
sources.shortName: Castelvecchio (Old Castle) - Verona, Italy

sources.snippet: The guided tour of Castelvecchio is an excellent completion of an itinerary in Verona or it can be a stand-alone tour to explore historical and artistic themes.
sources.shortName: Castelvecchio Museum in Verona - Guide and Tours

places.name: Castelvecchio Museum

reviews.text: Looks a little worn around the outside but what a history and it's all there for you to explore. . . very, very reasonable cost and a wealth of exhibits and artwork . . spent far longer here than I imagined . . Staff are friendly and helpful. If you visit Verona, it must be on your list.

Medieval fortress with moat. Probably the best value attraction in Verona, beautifully restored. We spent 3hrs here, exploring the countless corridors and halls. You can also access the battlements and part of the tower. Which has beautiful views of the river and city. There are numerous pieces of veronian artwork including paintings and sculptures. With also a large collection of medieval items of warfare and everyday items. All very interesting with a rich historical significance.

A must on your visit, whether your here for a week or just a few days.
Enjoy!

Very nice museum with an impressive collection of religious art, among other artifacts and weaponry. The entry costs 9 euros and you will have to wait if you go in the morning as there was only one person attending with the tickets' purchase. Do not miss it if you like art and history!

places.generalDescription: Ponte Scaligero is a historic bridge in Verona, Italy, with a rich past dating back to the 14th century. It features brick and marble construction with three spans and arches. The bridge was reconstructed after being destroyed during World War II, using parts of the original structure. Visitors can enjoy stunning river and city views from the bridge, as well as picturesque photo opportunities along its narrow walkway.

sources.snippet: On the banks of the Adige, Castelvecchio was built by the Scaligeri in 1354-55, an impressive defensive fortress certain to remind any rivals of the power of the della Scala family. Crossing the river is the beautiful castellated Ponte Scaligero, a 14th-century bridge that's traffic free and among the locals' favorite places to go for a stroll. The castle's main tower and ramparts afford views of the bridge, the city, and surrounding hills.
sources.shortName: 17 Top-Rated Attractions & Things to Do in Verona

sources.snippet: Noteworthy is the bridge that crosses the Adige river, known as the Ponte di Castelvecchio or Ponte Scaligero, celebrated by historians as one of the most daring and wonderful works of the Middle Ages.
sources.shortName: Guide to Castelvecchio di Verona: what to see, times and prices

places.name: Scaliger Bridge

reviews.text: A nice bridge with beautiful views of the city. The current bridge was re constructed after WWI. The bridge connects the historic Verona to the more modern one. A very idyllic place.

The Bridge is attached to the Medieval fortress, it has beautiful views of the river and city.

A must on your visit, whether your here for a week or just a few days.
Enjoy!

Picturesque red brick bridge spanning the Adige river.
Was built in 14th century but was destroyed by the retreating German army in 1945 and rebuilt using the same bricks by 1951.

places.generalDescription: Arco dei Gavi is a massive ancient white-marble arch that was originally constructed during the first century AD as part of the city defenses and served as a major gate into what is now the historic city center. It was dismantled by the French and later reassembled in 1932. The town of Arco, where it is located, has a Tyrolean feel with a ruined castle, beautiful churches, and palaces.

sources.snippet: Evidence of ancient Rome can be found everywhere in Verona: from Porta Borsari, once the entrance to the city, to Porta Leoni, from Ponte Pietra to the splendid Teatro Romano overlooking the Adige and the Arci dei Gavi next to the Castelvecchio. No trip to Verona is complete without a visit to the Arena, the breathtaking amphitheatre in Piazza Bra which dates back to the 1st century AD. And there is more, such as the remains of the Capitolium where the 17th century Palazzo Maffei now stands, in Piazza Erbe, which used to be a Roman forum.
sources.shortName: Museums, Monuments, Churches, Ancient Palaces and Hidden Gems

sources.snippet: Reminiscent of the Arch of Constantine in Rome, the Arco dei Gavi was constructed during the first century AD and would have originally served as part of the city defences and been a major gate into what is now the historic city centre. The original inscription of the pediment on the arch read ‚ÄúLucius Vitruvius Libertus‚Äù. During the Napoleonic era, the arch was actually demolished and it was not properly rebuilt using original designs until the 20th century.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Verona (Italy)

sources.snippet: Napoleon also used Castelvecchio as the headquarters for his army, and to adapt the surrounding buildings to his military needs he destroyed various buildings, including the Arco dei Gavi, a Roman monument from the 1st century AD. It was later renovated and placed next to the Castle. The Austrians also continued to use it as a military fortress and as a depot for weapons, and it also became the seat for a military tribunal.
sources.shortName: Guide to Castelvecchio di Verona: what to see, times and prices

sources.snippet: In 1805, Arco dei Gavi, which was integral part of the fortification, was dismantled by the French for reasons of military security and, for the same reason, the adjacent Clock Tower was completely demolished.
sources.shortName: Castelvecchio ‚Äì Verona, Veneto

places.name: Arco dei Gavi

reviews.text: Romantic place for lovers. River, old castle, green garden, ducks, bridges.... and just imagine to hug some sweet girl...

The Arco dei Gavi is a roman gateway set in a small park overlooked by Castlevecchio, with seats and a view of the river and bridges. The arch had been dismantled by Napoleon to send to France, however it was eventually reassembled in 1932 as all the sections had been numbered originally by the romans. The original position of the arch is marked by marble stone slabs in the roadway outside Castelvecchio and a marble plaque details this on the castle wall.

A Roman gateway impressive enough for Napoleon to dismantle ready for shipment back to France. Its original position is marked by marble stone slabs in the roadway outside Castelvecchio and a marble plaque on the wall. Not reassembled until 1932 it now sits alongside Castelvecchio in a small square. Open access 24 hours.

places.generalDescription: Piazzale Castel S. Pietro is a medieval fortress located on a hilltop above Verona, offering breathtaking views of the city from its terrace. The best time to visit is at sunset when the sky transforms into a beautiful display of oranges and the sun dips below the horizon. The architecture of this historic building is remarkable, and it was strategically positioned by the Romans for defense against intruders.

sources.snippet:
The Piazzale Castel
San Pietro (‚ÄúSt. Peter‚Äôs Castle‚Äù) is a hilltop fortress that lies on the
northern bank of the Adige River. As
the site of an ancient Roman fortress, the Castel
San Pietro was built in 1398 and demolished in 1801. Though the castle‚Äôs
interior isn‚Äôt open to the public, there are terraces and cafes beside it that
offer sweeping vistas of Verona.
sources.shortName: 15 Incredible Things to See in Verona (You Will Fall In Love!)

places.name: Piazzale Castel S. Pietro

reviews.text: Lovely view on the city from up here.
Beautiful view of the town. The steps leading to the top are very well maintained, the top can also be reached by cable or tour bus. A must do while at Verona.
Great place to observe the city and lovely girls...ü§©üòä‚öòÔ∏èüå∑üåπüíãü´∂

sources.snippet: The castle of Montorio is a medieval castle located on the hill of Montorio Veronese dating back to 995. In the fourteenth century the castle had two parts and after the restoration of 2010, only the largest part of the castle was opened to the public. Castles, palaces and mansions
sources.shortName: Castles of Verona, palaces and mansions

places.name: Castello di Montorio

reviews.text: Nice castle with a lot of history. Worth to visit when you're interested in Middle ages. The guide tried his best to speak good English, which was nice.
We just wanted to park at the parking as we were traveling and we wanted to spend the night at some chill place. The castle was sadly closed.
Cool piece of history of Verona. Roman era

places.address: Via Castel Montorio, 10, 37141 Verona VR, Italy

places.generalDescription: Castel San Pietro is a medieval fortress located on a hill overlooking the city of Verona. The fortress, built in 1398, offers stunning panoramic views of the surrounding area. Visitors can reach the castle by taking the Funicolare di Castel San Pietro, a funicular railway that runs up to the hill. While entry into the castle itself is not permitted, many tourists enjoy walking through the beautiful tree-lined streets and capturing picturesque views of Verona from this vantage point.

sources.snippet: Verona was founded to the site of current Castel San Pietro. This green hill, crowned by cypresses, is home to the remains of the first settlements dating back to the 7th century B.C. From this magnificent vantage-point you can enjoy the view of the whole city spreading out, with its network of Roman Roads, its walls, tall towers and steeples and, if your eyesight is good, you can even make out part of the Arena and the Ponte Scaligero.
sources.shortName: San Pietro Castle, Verona, Italy

sources.snippet: Castel San Pietro is the Italian name given to the military fortress standing on St. Peter‚Äôs Hill in Verona. The castle complex is an identifiable symbol of Verona, just a few dozens meters above the Roman Theatre that sits on the banks of the river Adige. The architectural wonder is easily visible from different parts of the city due to its location on the hill and is a popular attraction for both locals and tourists.
sources.shortName: Castel San Pietro, Verona

sources.snippet: It only took the name of ‚ÄúCastelvecchio‚Äù after the Visconti family built the ‚Äúnew‚Äù castle on the hill of San Pietro in 1398. As previously mentioned, Castelvecchio was built in 1300 by Cangrande II della Scala for defensive purposes. In fact, during that period the Signoria was already in decline and many surrounding cities were expanding territorially, such as Venice, Milan and Mantua.
sources.shortName: Guide to Castelvecchio di Verona: what to see, times and prices

sources.snippet: Holding a strategic position on the eastern bank of the Adige, the Castle of Saint Peter sits on a slightly elevated hill and has been inhabited since Roman times. Originally, a church dedicated to Saint Peter stood here which gives the castle its name. During the 1300‚Äôs the actual castle was built as a means of fortification for the city and stood firm for over 400 years.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Verona (Italy)

sources.snippet: Castel San Pietro is located on the San Pietro hill from where you can also see a wonderful view. Initially it was a military building, then after a restoration it became a museum to give the opportunity to those interested in being able to visit it. Nowadays, the building is unused.
sources.shortName: Castles of Verona, palaces and mansions
Castelvecchio ‚Äì Verona, Veneto
13 Wonderful Things To Do in Verona

places.name: Castel San Pietro

reviews.text:
The Castel San Pietro is a historic fortress located near the historic centre of Verona. the hill: Colle San Pietro was first developed as a military fort in the 12th and 13th centuries with a current buildings on-site dating back to the mid nineteenth century, constructed during Austrian rule.

There was a lovely hike to the summit of Castel San Pietro, offering panoramic views down to the river and across all of Verona. I can certainly recommend a visit.

Fantastic spot to get a full view of the City of Verona. Stunning views. Small funicular railway takes you to the top where you can get lovely coffees, deserts and ice creams on a hot day. The peace and quiet up here is just what you need after leaving the city streets.

I highly recommend coming here just for the views. There was a musician playing the guitar by the name of Claudio Romano, and he played Corcovado so nicely that I bought his CD for 10 euro (see videos for sound). I parked here, and took an automated tram that allowed us to not have to hike up in hot weather.

places.address: Piazzale Castel S. Pietro, 2, 37129 Verona VR, Italy

sources.snippet: The Gisella Fort dates back to 1862, the date on which it began its activity. Initially it included a large area, with several buildings scattered around the neighboring area. Its main function was that of defense and military.
sources.shortName: Castles of Verona, palaces and mansions

reviews.text: Really nice open spaces, good walk along the walls with many informational boards about the flowers, trees and so on public bathrooms just outside the gate and there's a bar just along the entrance ramp.
you can rent the place for wedding and any cerimony, its beautiful green park,
Nothing special, a potential cute little walk nonethelessü¶¢

places.generalDescription: Castelvecchio is a must-see attraction in Verona, offering free entry to its medieval castle and museum. The well-preserved castle has been restored and renovated, housing an educational museum with an armory, statues, and artifacts. Visitors can enjoy a fantastic view from the bridge over the Etsch River and explore paintings from various eras inside the castle museum.

sources.snippet: Evidence of ancient Rome can be found everywhere in Verona: from Porta Borsari, once the entrance to the city, to Porta Leoni, from Ponte Pietra to the splendid Teatro Romano overlooking the Adige and the Arci dei Gavi next to the Castelvecchio. No trip to Verona is complete without a visit to the Arena, the breathtaking amphitheatre in Piazza Bra which dates back to the 1st century AD. And there is more, such as the remains of the Capitolium where the 17th century Palazzo Maffei now stands, in Piazza Erbe, which used to be a Roman forum.
sources.shortName: Museums, Monuments, Churches, Ancient Palaces and Hidden Gems

sources.snippet: The magnificent structure of Castelvecchio which means the Old castle, hosts one of the fascinating museums, not only in Italy but in the entire Europe. The building exhibits exciting art collections and is well-known for its rich history and architectural value. Castelvecchio was built in 1355 by the Della Scala family, the ruling dynasty of Verona in the middle age.
sources.shortName: Castelvecchio (Old Castle) - Verona, Italy

sources.snippet: The Castelvecchio (‚ÄúOld Castle‚Äù) is a castle and bridge tucked between the Centro Storico and Adige River. As you roam its medieval walls, you‚Äôll feel as if you stepped back in time. Originally built as a royal palace, it was converted into an urban fortress soon after its construction.
sources.shortName: 15 Incredible Things to See in Verona (You Will Fall In Love!)

sources.snippet: Castelvecchio (Old Castle) is a medieval castle located in the historical center of Verona, currently used as the seat of the homonymous civic museum. The castle is the most important military construction of the Scaliger dynasty, the family that ruled the city in the Middle Ages.
sources.shortName: Castelvecchio ‚Äì Verona, Veneto

sources.snippet: In Verona, near Lake Garda, there is the fortress Castelvecchio. You can reach it from Verona train station via Corso Porta Nuova and Via Roma.
sources.shortName: Castelvecchio in Verona. Discover Lake Garda!
Guide to Castelvecchio di Verona: what to see, times and prices
13 Wonderful Things To Do in Verona
Castles of Verona, palaces and mansions

places.name: Castelvecchio

reviews.text: What an amazing medieval castle, it's very well kept, it's been restored and renovated. It's in very good condition and it's definitely very fascinating. Very educational and interesting, it has a museum located inside. It has an armoury and several statues and artifacts in and around the ground as well as a lovely bridge close by. I would definitely recommend checking it out.

(Translated by Google) One of Verona's sights. Entry is free (except the museum). The bridge over the Etsch, which you can reach from the castell, is a real highlight, you have a fantastic view from there. On the other bank of the Etsch, the city is completely different. You can walk down the steps to the river and enjoy the peace and quiet on the sandbanks. A fixed point for every city tour!
